review: Bought it cause I thought I wouldn't need a power supply. I was wrong. You still need a power supply but if you have a newer model TV, you can use the USB port to power it up, meaning no cables going for the wall. The software feels polished. Fast and user friendly. It even starts with a demo video to show you it's features.
author: Joseann J. Robles

review: The only reason why I didn't give this device 5 stars is that I think the device could be faster.Load times for the apps are a little laggy.Setup was a breeze, although forcing a person to watch the tutorial was frustrating.I have purchased two of these devices and everyone in the household has enjoyed them.The remote would be nicer if it didn't make such a loud clicking noise. I did find a fix, use your mobile device as the remote with the free app.It has taken the place of a gaming system for streaming Amazon/Netflix/Plex, kids (or adults) should will be pleased to hear.I was glad to see that I can use my Plex server with this device and not have to rely on the big named online services for my entertainment.I recommend you use the enclosed HDMI extension cable to receive the best signal from your wireless network. If you still have issues, check the channel your wireless signal is currently running and try changing it to a less busy channel. I had some connectivity issues and resolved them with the above.Over all worth the money.
